text: Has anyone run an employee social media training to turn every employee into a brand advocate and promote your firm's social channel's content? Can you share your training?

elements.text: Has anyone run an employee social media training to turn every employee into a brand advocate and promote your firm's social channel's content? Can you share your training?

text:
We don’t run a training but we do have an informal employee social media advocacy program.

It started with a Slack channel where we share new content to promote, along with suggested copy to make it easier on the employees. In the Slack channel we also share best practices for posting other content that’s not related to our company, to help people develop well-rounded social profiles.

We’ve evolved into executive communications as well. We’ll craft longer LinkedIn posts for execs to use to promote their latest blog posts, press interviews, podcast appearances, etc.

For all of these initiatives, we create specific tracking URLs so we can see how much traffic employee social generates. And it’s actually been more successful than our company channels!

I love talking about this topic and would be happy to discuss further. There’s such power in numbers with employee social.

text: You could look into paying for personal branding courses for employees. It would make it easier for them to be brand ambassadors as they'd already have a following and they can be more effective for your company
